features.featureTitle: Update the “After the Session” copy in the “What to Expect from The Clearing” section (frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx) to remove the statement that there is “no ongoing relationship,” and replace it with wording that (a) clearly avoids client dependency and (b) still welcomes/permits ongoing connection (e.g., future contact or staying connected) in a bounded, non-dependent way. Use English for all user-facing text.

Reorder the landing-page sections so the “Readiness” section (currently rendered by frontend/src/components/WhoThisIsFor.tsx) appears immediately after the “Foundation” section (frontend/src/components/WhatItIs.tsx) near the top of the landing page. Implement by updating the render order in frontend/src/App.tsx without removing any sections.

Revise the copy in the “What to Expect from The Clearing” section (frontend/src/components/WhatToExpect.tsx) to more strongly and concretely communicate the immense opportunity/value and specific practical benefits of the session, while still maintaining readiness-filtering language and an informative (not “seductive”) tone. Use practical, tangible, visible, helpful outcome language (e.g., clarity on decisions, naming the real issue, identifying next steps, seeing patterns/choices). Use English for all user-facing text.
